The album's done in close collaboration with David Axelrod Ã¢â‚¬â€œ who'd handled Cannon's big live dates for Capitol in the 60s Ã¢â‚¬â€œ but this record is much more freewheeling, open-ended, fuzz, funky, and electric overall! Tracks are all nice and long, and really trip out in the best way Ã¢â‚¬â€œ with keyboards from George Duke in the core group, plus some heavy basslines from Walter Booker, drums from Roy McCurdy, and guitar from Mike Deasy on a number of key tracks.

Deasy plays with lots of great wah wah and fuzz Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and the album also features guest work from Airto on percussion and Ernie Watts on tenor Ã¢â‚¬â€œ plus Cannonball's great alto and the cornet of brother Nat Adderley too. There's a really collaborative feel to the whole thing Ã¢â‚¬â€œ as the record steps easily between a lot of heady styles Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and titles include "Zanek", "Eye Of The Cosmos", "The Scene", "The Chocolate Nuisance", "The Steam Drill", "Little Benny Hen", and "The Black Messiah".
